thread.title: Bicyclist struck by Metro train near NRG Stadium
thread.title_full: Bicyclist struck by Metro train near NRG Stadium

author: Lindsay Ellis, Dug Begley
title: Bicyclist struck by Metro train near NRG Stadium
text:
Bicyclist struck by Metro train near NRG Stadium Condition unknown; second bicyclist hit by train in two days By Lindsay Ellis and Dug Begley , Houston Chronicle Updated 7:35 pm, Sunday, February 5, 2017 
A bicyclist was struck by a Red Line train near NRG Stadium on Sunday evening - the second cyclist hit by a Metro train in two days. 
The man was hospitalized but his injuries were not considered life-threatening, according to Metro spokesman Jerome Gray. 
The man was riding eastbound in the westbound lanes of the Loop 610 frontage road when he turned into a northbound train about 6 p.m., Gray said. 
Rail service was delayed about 22 minutes. 
The area along the light rail tracks at Loop 610 has been a troublesome area for police and rail safety. Panhandlers and others often congregate near the area, and a handful have been hit in the past three years. 
On Friday morning, Rice University professor Marjorie Corcoran died after she was struck by a Metro light rail train at the Hermann Park rail stop.
